cluster_goals.Goal_name: Construct a program that creates an array of length 5 and fills it up with value 3.
cluster_goals.Output_desc: This program fills up array with value 3: [3,3,3,3,3]

cluster_goals.Goal_name: Drag a tile to the highlighted field to construct a program that creates an array of length 5 and fills up the array with the first five even integers.
cluster_goals.Output_desc: This program fills up array with first five even integers: [0,2,4,6,8]

cluster_goals.Goal_name: Drag a tile to the highlighted field to construct a program that creates an array of length 5 and fills up the array with the first five odd integers.
cluster_goals.Output_desc: This program fills up array with first five odd integers: [1,3,5,7,9]

cluster_goals.Goal_name: Drag a tile to the highlighted field to construct a program that creates an array of length 5 and decrements each element of the array by 1.
cluster_goals.Output_desc: This program fills up array with integers: [5,4,3,2,1]

cluster_goals.Goal_name: Drag a tile to the highlighted field to construct a program that creates an array of length 5 and increment each element of the array by 1.
cluster_goals.Output_desc: This program fills up array with integers: [1,2,3,4,5]

help.help_desc: A list of integers is intialized with length 5. All elements of array will have default value 0.
A for loop for traversing the array and initializing each of its elements. The number of loop iteration is the same as the length of the list (i.e., 5).

Fragment.Fragment_text: for ( int i = 0; i < list.length; i++ ) {

help.help_desc: Assigns value 3 to the i-th element in the array.

Assigns an even number to i-th element in the array by multiplying the index i of that element by 2. The first iteration of loop assigns 0 to the first element of the array, the second iteration of loop assigns 2 to the second element of array, the third iteration of loop assigns 4 to the third element of array, and so on.

Assigns an odd number to i-th element in the array by multiplying the index i of that element by 2 and then increment it by 1. The first iteration of loop assigns 1 to the first element of the array, the second iteration of loop assigns 3 to the second element of array, the third iteration of loop assigns 5 to the third element of array, and so on.

Decrements the i-th element of the array by 1.  The first iteration of loop assigns -1 to the first element of the array, the second iteration of loop assigns -1 to the second element of array, the third iteration of loop assigns -1 to the third element of array, and so on.

Increments the i-th element of the array by 1.  The first iteration of loop assigns 1 to the first element of the array, the second iteration of loop assigns 1 to the second element of array, the third iteration of loop assigns 1 to the third element of array, and so on.
